TopicTitle: Which are some good real-life engine mods?

Articles.Content:
I recently downloaded Realism Overhaul for my KSP. THough I quite like mos tof it, I find its engine kinda, well, lazily-made. Therefore, I would like some good real-life engine mods, with realistic stats that can work with RSS and RealFuels. I would really appreciate if they either contain modern engines, or historic engines that are still used today.

Thanks in advance.

If you downloaded RO then surely you read the original post, yes? I addressed your post in the RO thread. There's more engines then you have memory for. FASA and the Soviet engines pack will be exactly what you want for starters.

> 
> If you downloaded RO then surely you read the original post, yes? I addressed your post in the RO thread. There's more engines then your pc has memory for. FASA and the Soviet engines pack will be exactly what you want for starters.

Oh, hello again. Well, maybe you are interested in reading my reply at RO.

Ahem...

> 
> 2. Messages
> 2.1 Definition of message
> 
> A message includes any and all means a user has available to communicate with other members. This includes, but is not limited to forum posts and private messages, IRC chat messages, Twitch chat messages, Curse and Facebook comments, links, avatars, signatures, usernames and general profile information.
> 
> 2.2 Forbidden content
> 
> Messages which contain, discuss or link to the following are explicitly forbidden:
> 
> (D) Insults and threats, **stalking or any other behavior construed to be of a potentially rude or otherwise harassing nature to/of other users**, members of the mod team or members of Squad;
Uhm...Did you just accuse me of stalking? I respond to his post in RO, hit "new posts" only to see he made a thread and chose to reply saying I responded to him in the other thread. Two posts...

> 
> Uhm...Did you just accuse me of stalking? I respond to his post in RO, hit "new posts" only to see he made a thread and chose to reply saying I responded to him in the other thread. Two posts...

I think he means that replying to this thread by telling me you've already replied to it elsewhere could be potentially considered offensive. Don't worry though, I find it completely legitimate, and no offense was taken.
